results.title: Broadcast news
results.creator_credit: James L. Brooks, James L. Brooks Films, Gracie Films and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Three ambitious workaholics are set loose in a network TV newsroom where their professional and personal lives become hopelessly cross wired. Writer-director James L. Brooks is a filmmaker who is able to brilliantly combine comedy and drama with rich characters and unforgettable dialogue. His satire on the media can also be seen on ‘The Simpsons’ for which he is Executive Producer. He paints a savage, knowing, hilarious look at the television news industry and also what can happen to your personal life when your job consumes you. The performances are simply phenomenal. William Hurt gives depth to a dimbulb anchor, but Holly Hunter and Albert Brooks walk away with the movie. Cast includes Jack Nicholson (unbilled) and Joan Cusack. Music by Bill Conti.

results.title: The Devil probably = Le Diablo problament [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Robert Bresson, Stephane Tchalgadjieff, M Chanderli Production and Sunchild GMF
results.brief_description: In hindsight, “The Devil probably” is one of the most prescient films to have arisen from the post-68 turmoil of French society. Bresson’s bleak but absorbing film examines the dissipated lives of young people who are aware they live in a world of ecological exploitation, and a world of consumerist greed, and whose response to that world is to drift into the apathy of unemployment, drugs, promiscuity and petty crime. The director, who also wrote the script, refuses to pathologise or romanticise his young characters and instead dignifies their stubborn resistance to conformity as a passive ethical opposition to a crumbling world. But he does not hide the ugliness or the cruelty of his characters. In this remarkable movie, Bresson explores the beginning of the western under-class which was to emerge with such alienated force at the end of the twentieth century. The film begins by posing a question: was a young man murdered or did he commit suicide? By the end of the film, this unanswerable question is left to haunt the viewer with its bitter suggestion that we are all in part responsible. In French with English subtitles. Cast includes Antoine Monnier, Tina Irassari and Laetita Carcano.

results.title: Blade
results.creator_credit: Stephen Norrington, Robert Engelman, Wesley Snipes, Peter Frankfurt and Amen Ra Films
results.brief_description: This very sleek vampire thriller comes with a strange trio of superheroes. Whistler (Kris Kristofferson), a terminally ill motor mechanic whose lost his family to vampires; haematologist Karen (N’Bushe Wright) who carries the vampire blood but has the medical background to cure herself, and Blade (Wesley Snipes), part human and part vampire since he became infected while in his mother’s womb. Blade’s DNA holds the key to completing the Blood Tide - an event that will turn the rest of the population into vampires. Deacon Frost (Stephen Dorff), arch enemy of Blade and an upstart wannabe vampire (Frost became a vampire after being bitten and is not one of the pure breeds who has been a blood sucker since birth), is leading the charge to achieve Blood Tide, and he has the support of vampires to achieve it. Only 3 people stand in his way. From the opening sequence of the film that depicts a nightclub with a difference, this vibrant mixture of martial arts and rock video provides a very different take on the vampire genre. Cast also includes Donal Logue, Udo Kier and Traci Lords. Based on characters included in “Marvel comics”.

results.title: The Confessional = Le Confessionnal
results.creator_credit: Robert Robert Lepage, Philippe Carcassonne, David Puttnam, Denise Robert, Cinea, Enigma Films and Cinemaginaire
results.brief_description: Past, present and the world of cinema merge in this unique and visually innovate thriller. Quebec, 1952, and the church is abuzz as master director Alfred Hitchcock (played by Ron Burrage) is in town to film “I Confess”. An equally gripping story is going on in the background - the elements echoing that of the plot, as 16 year old church worker, Rachel (Suzanne Clement), is with child to an unknown father, only a young priest knows the truth. Quebec, 1989 and Pierre (Lothaire Bluteau) returns home to attend the funeral of his father. During his stay Pierre vows to solve the mystery of the parentage of his half brother, Marc (Patrick Goyette)- Rachel’s son, a discontented rent boy and father of a young child. Pierre’s mission is not an easy one, as the secrets of the past and heredity cloud the situation and find resonance in the future. Like the plot of Hitchcock’s film, only one man holds the key to past and present that was disclosed to him in the confines of the confessional. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Horse whisperer
results.creator_credit: Robert Redford, Patrick Markey and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Robert Redford directs himself for the first time in this romantic drama adapted from the best-seller by Nicholas Evans. Teenager Grace and her friend Judith go horseback riding in upstate New York on a winter morning. After a devastating accident, Judith and her horse are killed, while Grace and her horse, Pilgrim, are seriously injured, the frightening incident leaving them both traumatised. Desperate to help, Grace’s mother puts her busy life on hold and travels west with Grace and Pilgrim to see a horse trainer with a special gift. Once there she discovers that his extraordinary gift with horses also touches the lives of those around him. Cast includes Robert Redford, Kristin Scott Thomas, Scarlett Johnasson, Sam Neill, Chris Cooper and Dianne Wiest.

results.title: The Last bus home
results.creator_credit: Johnny Gogan, Paul Donovan and Bandit Films Ltd
results.brief_description: Dublin forms the backdrop of this evocative film about friendship, punk music, secrets, sexuality, and Dublin in the late 70’s and early 80’s. Punks Reena (Annie Ryan) and Jessop (Brian O’Byrne) meet on the day the Pope comes to Dublin. They form an instant alliance both physically and musically, and together with bassist Joe (Barry Comerford) and drummer Petie (John Cronin), begin 3 years of work to gain recognition for their band; The Dead Patriots. Tensions rise personally, with repercussions professionally as one feeds off the other. The situation reaches a head when Jessop discovers a secret and makes his feelings known at the band’s final farewell gig. 10 years pass and the members re-unite for a final confrontation and re-unification. Cast also includes Anthony Brophy, Brendan Coyle and Donal O’Kelly.

results.title: A Summer's tale = Conte d'ete
results.creator_credit: Eric Rohmer, Margaret Menegoz, Canal+, Sofilmka, La Sept Cinema and Les Films du Losange
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Tales of the four seasons = Contes des quatre saisons”.
Gaspard (Melvil Poupard), a musically inclined maths graduate with time to kill is waiting for his girlfriend, Lena, in the resort town of Dinard, unbeknownst that his stable and uneventful life is about to be turned on it head when he becomes torn between his affections for three women. He whiles away the lazy afternoon hours with Margot (Amanda Langlet), a part time student and pancake house worker, and most importantly - a good listener. Margot wants a purely platonic relationship with Gaspard as she already has a boyfriend. Enter likely candidate number three, Margot’s friend Solene (Gwenaelle Simon), whom Gaspard becomes instantly smitten with and agrees to spend a weekend with on the island of Ouessant. When Lena finally arrives on the island Gaspard must finally make a choice between three women who are all offering him something different in the relationship stakes. In French with English subtitles. This film, the third in Rohmer’s “4 Season cycle” finds the director in fine story telling form.

results.title: Aguirre: wrath of God
results.creator_credit: Werner Herzog and Werner Herzog Filmproduktion
results.brief_description: A stunning and gruelling adventure about a band of Spanish conquistadors led by Aguirre, and their descent into the heart of darkness while exploring the Amazon in search of El Dorado, the legendary city of Gold. As the expedition moves further into the jungle, they leave reality behind and enter a dreamlike, otherwordly land of delusion and madness. In German with English subtitles. Cast includes Klaus Kinski, Cecilia Rivera, Ruy Guerra, Helena Rojo, Del Negro and Daniel Zacapa. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Beyond a reasonable doubt
results.creator_credit: Fritz Lang, Bert Friedlob and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Guilty beyond a reasonable doubt - such is the incontrovertible law which pardons the innocent and condemns the guilty. But just how fallible is the process of law? To what extent can deceit, prejudice - and the cruel powers of fate - intervene to set a murderer free, or send an innocent man to the electric chair? Dana Andrews plays Tom Carret, a writer who becomes obsessed with the idea of proving that it is possible for a completely innocent man to be found guilty of murder. And when a pretty showgirl is found strangled in a ravine, and no killer can be found, the perfect opportunity presents itself. This dark and chilling drama is the last film Lang made in Hollywood.

results.title: Lucia
results.creator_credit: Humberto Solas, Camilo Vives, Raul Canosa and Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC)
results.brief_description: Acclaimed worldwide as the `Gone With the Wind of the Cuban film industry’, ‘Lucia’ is indeed Cuba’s first film spectacular, an epic, three-part feature film dramatizing three separate periods in the Cuban struggle for liberation in order to show the participation of Cuban women in that fight. In 1895, Lucia is embroiled in a tale of love and betrayal during Cuba’s war for independence from Spain; in 1933, Lucia leaves her middle-class family and becomes involved in the overthrow of the Cuban dictator Machado; and in the 1960’s, Lucia is taught how to read and write during Cuba’s literacy campaign and, as a newlywed, confronts her husband’s macho attitudes. Each episode is filmed in a distinctive visual style which translates the spirit of each historical era, with the themes of love, death and war achieving epic proportions, and providing the viewer with a good example of the role of women in history. In Spanish with English subtitles. Cast includes Raquel Revuelta, Eduardo Maure and Eslinda Nunez. (Awards: Golden Globe 1969)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Humberto Solas, Camilo Vives, Raul Canosa and Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC)
results.description: Acclaimed worldwide as the `Gone With the Wind of the Cuban film industry’, ‘Lucia’ is indeed Cuba’s first film spectacular, an epic, three-part feature film dramatizing three separate periods in the Cuban struggle for liberation in order to show the participation of Cuban women in that fight. In 1895, Lucia is embroiled in a tale of love and betrayal during Cuba’s war for independence from Spain; in 1933, Lucia leaves her middle-class family and becomes involved in the overthrow of the Cuban dictator Machado; and in the 1960’s, Lucia is taught how to read and write during Cuba’s literacy campaign and, as a newlywed, confronts her husband’s macho attitudes. Each episode is filmed in a distinctive visual style which translates the spirit of each historical era, with the themes of love, death and war achieving epic proportions, and providing the viewer with a good example of the role of women in history. In Spanish with English subtitles. Cast includes Raquel Revuelta, Eduardo Maure and Eslinda Nunez. (Awards: Golden Globe 1969)
description_for_label: Acclaimed worldwide as the `Gone With the Wind of the Cuban film industry’, ‘Lucia’ is indeed Cuba’s first film spectacular, an epic, three-part feature film dramatizing three separate periods in the Cuban struggle for liberation in order to show the participation of Cuban women in that fight. In 1895, Lucia is embroiled in a tale of love and betrayal during Cuba’s war for independence from Spain; in 1933, Lucia leaves her middle-class family and becomes involved in the overthrow of the Cuban dictator Machado; and in the 1960’s, Lucia is taught how to read and write during Cuba’s literacy campaign and, as a newlywed, confronts her husband’s macho attitudes. Each episode is filmed in a distinctive visual style which translates the spirit of each historical era, with the themes of love, death and war achieving epic proportions, and providing the viewer with a good example of the role of women in history. In Spanish with English subtitles. Cast includes Raquel Revuelta, Eduardo Maure and Eslinda Nunez. (Awards: Golden Globe 1969)
